Serpentine optical constants used in Bauer et al. 2003 (Icarus
158, 178-190, 2002).  They were Derived from reflectance data
using SEM imaging to determine grain size and an inversion of
Hapke theory.  Initial assumption was that the real index had
a constant value of 1.55 over the wavelength domain.  This
resulted in initial estimates of the imaginary index.  These
values of the imginary index were used in a subtractive
Krammers-Kronig analysis (KK)to determine the wavelength
dependence of the real index.  This Hapke-KK process was
iterated until neither the real or imaginary index changed
significantly.
  Wavelenth  Inverse     Real    Imaginary
  (microns)    cm       Index    Index
    4.5319   2206.60   1.58269  1.8288E-02
    4.4705   2236.90   1.58033  1.6040E-02
    4.4090   2268.10   1.57060  1.5229E-02
    4.2624   2346.10   1.57731  1.4768E-02
    4.2178   2370.90   1.56909  1.3900E-02
    4.1736   2396.00   1.57005  1.5183E-02
    4.1298   2421.40   1.57026  1.3348E-02
    4.0865   2447.10   1.56986  1.5957E-02
    4.0433   2473.20   1.56915  1.3823E-02
    4.0006   2499.60   1.56958  1.3787E-02
    3.9582   2526.40   1.56968  1.4535E-02
    3.9160   2553.60   1.56903  1.5423E-02
    3.8743   2581.10   1.56880  1.3733E-02
    3.8327   2609.10   1.56962  1.3762E-02
    3.7915   2637.50   1.56971  1.5383E-02
    3.7505   2666.30   1.56939  1.5155E-02
    3.7097   2695.60   1.56954  1.5255E-02
    3.6693   2725.30   1.56981  1.5564E-02
    3.6291   2755.50   1.56968  1.6815E-02

    3.5492   2817.50   1.56895  1.6279E-02
    3.5096   2849.30   1.56947  1.5975E-02
